intro: Tricalysia niamniamensis var. djurensis, commonly known as the Niamniamensis variant, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
